alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:02AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL BAYFIELD, SOUTHWESTERN ASHLAND AND NORTH CENTRAL SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM CDT... At 602 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Namekagon, or 15 miles north of Chippewa Flowage East, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clam Lake around 615 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Glidden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
